casebody.data:
OCEAN HILL
v.
CURRITUCK BOARD OF COMM. No. 382PA06. Supreme Court of North Carolina. November 22, 2006. John R. Wester, Jonathan C. Krisko, Charlotte, Thomas P. Nash, IV, C. Everett Thompson, II, Elizabeth City, for Ocean Hill I Prop. Owners Asso. Katherine F. McKenzie, Raleigh, for Currituck County Bd. of Comm. Paul A. Meyer, Assistant General Counsel, for NC Asso. of County Commissioners. Andrew L. Romanet, Jr., General Counsel, Gregory F. Schwitzgebel, III, Senior Assistant General Counsel, for NC League of Municipalities. *446Ashley R. Heaton, Assistant City Attorney, for City of Charlotte.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 21st day of November 2006 by City of Charlotte for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed. Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i). By order of the Court in conference this the 22nd day of November 2006."
